SimpleCipher.Strings

Class CustomPasswordFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleCipher.Strings.CustomPasswordFilter

  • public class CustomPasswordFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Create object of this class to enable custom password filters.
    Since:
    21st June 2017
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Sudipta Saha

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      This function returns an instance of CustomPasswordFilter.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CustomPasswordFilter getInstance(java.lang.String alphabetSet,
                                               int minAlphabets,
                                               java.lang.String digitSet,
                                               int minDigits,
                                               java.lang.String symbolSet,
                                               int minSymbols,
                                               int minCharacter,
                                               int maxCharacter)
                                        throws InvalidFormatException
        This function returns an instance of CustomPasswordFilter. It is required in case of user defined password parameters.
        Parameters:
        alphabetSet - String of alphabets that the password may contain. Separate alphabets for uppercase and lowercase. The alphabets need to be put sequentially without any space. 
         For example, "ABCdef" will check for A,B,C,d,e,f and will not allow a,b,c,D,E,F.
        minAlphabets - The minimum number of alphabet characters that the custom password may contain.
        digitSet - String of digits that the password may contain. The digits need to be put sequentially without any space. 
        For example, "0178" will check for 0,1,7,8.
        minDigits - The minimum number of digit characters that the custom password may contain.
        symbolSet - String of symbols that the password may contain. The set of symbols permitted are $,@,!,%,*,#,?,& The digits need to be put sequentially without any space.
        minSymbols - The minimum number of symbol characters that the custom password may contain.
        minCharacter - Total number of minimum characters the password might contain.
        maxCharacter - Total number of maximum characters the password might contain. In case of unrestricted maximum characters, put maxCharacter as 0.
        Returns:
        instance of CustomPasswordFilter.
        Throws:
        InvalidFormatException - Throws exception if any of the input strings of alphabets, digits or symbols are invalid.
